page.title: 14ASHINGTON MANOR FARM.
page.content: Ashington Manor Farm consists of 800 acres of land and a manor house built in 1485.The farmer keeps 230 fresian cows on 450 acres of arable land.The cows give on average 1,160,000 litres of milk a year.2,500 tonnes of silage is made to feed the cows in winter. A fork on a tractor is used to pick up nearly a tonne of silage at a time which is then fed to the cows.On the rest of his land he grows mainly wheat and barley.The wheat is sent to a mill to be ground into flour.The barley is used to feed the 140 pigs he keeps to fatten for bacon and pork.As pigs are prone to disease and very sensitive to the environment they try hard to keep all animals clean and healthy.When something mechanical breaks they repair it and make their own trailers. 7 full-time workers and 1 part timer work on the farm.
